message.entry: The error was within absolute tolerance.
The error was within relative tolerance.
The error was not within absolute tolerance.
The error was not within relative tolerance.

entry.note: Example: The tolerance was ignored for int8 values. The tolerance as specified only applies to: single, double.

message.entry: The tolerance was ignored for {0} values. The tolerance as specified only applies to: {1}.
The sizes of the tolerances being combined do not match for type {0}.
Relative tolerance value must be a floating point data type.
Only one tolerance value can be specified for each data type.
Tolerance value must be a numeric array or a MATLAB object.
Tolerance value must be non-empty, real, non-negative, and finite.
Expected value must be a numeric array or a MATLAB object.
When the tolerance value is non-scalar, it must have the same size as the expected value.
